Description: Lip and wall fragment of East Greek pottery bowl; interior glazed with added red stripe; exterior: reserved band below the rim, with part of an incised inscription; glazed below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Edgar incorrectly identifies the sherd as belonging to a Chian cup.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 53, no. 4b, pl. IV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.184)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
